arm_group.description:
Vaccine
Flubio (Influenza HA) vaccine
2 doses for infants and children (6 months - 8 years old)
1 doses for children (9-11 years old)
The vaccine will be given intramuscularly

brief_summary.textblock:
To Asses the Immunogenicity and Safety of Flubio (Influenza HA) Vaccine in Infants and
      Children (Bridging Study)

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenocity and Safety of Flubio (Influenza HA) Vaccine in Infants and Children (Bridging Study)

detailed_description.textblock:
Too see percentage of subjects with HI titer >= 1:40, 28 days after two doses in infants and
      children (6 months-8 years old) and one dose in children 9-11 years old for each strain.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy

          -  Parents have been informed properly regarding the study and signed the informed
             consent form

          -  Parents will commit themselves to comply with the instructions of the investigator
             and the schedule of the trial

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects concomitantly enrolled or scheduled to be enrolled in another trial

          -  Evolving mild, moderate, or severe illness, especially infectious diseases or fever
             (axillary temperature >=37oC)

          -  Known history of allergy to egg and/or chicken protein or any other component of the
             vaccines

          -  Known history of uncontrolled coagulopathy or blood disorders contraindicating
             intramuscular injection

          -  Subject who has received a treatment likely to alter the immune response in the
             previous 4 weeks (intravenous immunoglobulins, blood-derived products or long term
             corticotherapy (>2 weeks)).

          -  Any abnormality or chronic disease justified by investigator that might interfere
             assessment of the trial objectives.

          -  Subjects has been immunized with influenza vaccine within 1 year

          -  Subjects receives any vaccination within 1 months before and after immunization of
             Flubio.

intervention.description:
Flubio (Influenza HA) Vaccine
The vaccine will be given intramuscularly.

facility.name: Primary School of SDN 01 Kampung Melayu

clinical_study.official_title: Phase II b Study of Immunogenicity and Safety of Flubio Vaccine in Infants and Children

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Child Health School of Medicine, University of Indonesia

oversight_info.authority: Indonesia: National Agency of Drug and Food Control

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with anti HI titer >=1:40
primary_outcome.measure: To asses the immunogenicity of Flubio vaccine 28 days after 2 doses immunization in infants and children (6 months-8 years of age) and 1 dose immunization in children (9-11 years of age)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage subjects with increasing antibody titer >=4 times
secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the seroconversion after 2 doses of Flubio vaccine in infants and children (6 months-8 years old)

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with transition of seronegative to seropositive
secondary_outcome.measure: To describe seroconversion after 1 dose of Flubio vaccine in children (9-11 years old)

secondary_outcome.description: Local and Systemic Reaction following immunization
secondary_outcome.measure: To asses the safety of Flubio vaccine

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
